newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore PM sees 4-6 pct growth for next 20 years.
newsitem.headline: Singapore PM sees 4-6 pct growth for next 20 years.

text.p: Singapore Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong said sustainable growth for the economy over the next 20 years should average four to six percent annually as the country matures.

In an interview with five Filipino journalists released on Saturday, Goh said, "We think that the sustainable growth of Singapore per year over the next 20 years should average about four to six percent."
"There is no slack labour, land is becoming expensive, the economy has matured."
A transcript of the interview, conducted on May 30, was released by the government.
Goh said, "But we hope to get one or two percent growth from the region. This is where the national product should grow faster than the domestic product."

Earlier this month, the Ministry of Trade and Industry said Singapore should have five to seven percent economic growth for the next decade after experiencing an average of 8.6 percent domestic growth annually in the five years to 1996.
